org.soulwing.cdi.properties.spi

Interface PropertyResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPackagePathPropertyResolver, ClassPathBeanPropertiesResolver, JndiEnvBeanPropertiesResolver, JndiEnvUrlPathBeanPropertiesResolver, MetaInfBeanPropertiesResolver, SystemPropertiesResolver, SystemPropertyFileResolver, UrlPathBeanPropertiesResolver

    public interface PropertyResolver
    An object that resolves a property name to a value.

    A property resolver is configured for the Pinject extension by placing a provider configuration file in the resource directory META-INF/services of a directory or JAR file on the classpath of the extension. The name of the configuration file is:

    org.soulwing.cdi.properties.spi.PropertyResolver

    The file may contain one or more fully-qualified class names of classes that implement this interface.

    Author:
    Carl Harris

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Notifies this property resolver that it is no longer needed and that it should consequently release any resources that it is holding.
      int getPriority()
      Gets the priority of this resolver relative to other resolvers.
      void init()
      Initializes this property resolver.
      String resolve(String name)
      Resolves a property name to a value.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
          throws Exception
        Initializes this property resolver.
        Throws:
        Exception - to indicate that initialization failed

      • destroy

        void destroy()
             throws Exception
        Notifies this property resolver that it is no longer needed and that it should consequently release any resources that it is holding.
        Throws:
        Exception - to indicate that the resolver was not successful in cleaning up the resources it holds

      • getPriority

        int getPriority()
        Gets the priority of this resolver relative to other resolvers.

        Given resolvers A and B, resolver A will be consulted before resolver B iff A.getPriority() > B.getPriority().

        Returns:
        priority

      • resolve

        String resolve(String name)
        Resolves a property name to a value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to resolve
        Returns:
        value or null if name has no corresponding value known to this resolver
